snippet: In the DOC NYC nonfiction film festival, honesty and truthfulness are often in conflict with painful images on which people would rather not dwell.
abstract: Stephen Holden Critic's Notebook explores seesaw between hope and despair of socially engaged documentaries to be screened at upcoming DOC NYC nonfiction film festival at SVA Theater in Chelsea; Amy Berg film An Open Secret, an expose of sexual exploitation of children who go to Hollywood seeking fame, is one of the most anticipated movies of the festival.
lead_paragraph: In the DOC NYC nonfiction film festival, honesty and truthfulness are often in conflict with painful images on which people would rather not dwell.

headline.seo: The DOC NYC Film Festival Returns
headline.main: Images That Dare You to Turn Away
headline.print_headline: Images That Dare You to Turn Away
